programme.title: Die Wilden Hühner
Die wilden Hühner
programme.desc: Die Wilden Hühner: Directed by Vivian Naefe. With Michelle von Treuberg, Lucie Hollmann, Paula Romy, Zsá Zsá Inci. Sprotte is about 12 years old and has a "gang" with her three friends Frieda, Melanie and Trude. Together the girls take Care of Sprottes grandmothers chickens. The new girl in School, Wilma, wishes to join the group, which Melanie is very unhappy about, and on top of all of that they have an on going revalisasion with a group of boys. Sprottes grandmother is planning on slaughtering the chickens! Will the Wild Chicks put Down their war with the boys? And Will they be able to save the chicken?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0466195/","name":"Die Wilden Hühner","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjA4ZjM0ZDMtMDdmZi00NzJhLWE3YjItOGVlZTZjZjE0Y2M1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzA3Njg4MzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Sprotte is about 12 years old and has a "gang" with her three friends Frieda, Melanie and Trude. The new girl in School, Wilma, wishes to join the group, which Melanie i","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0466195/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Xenzi"},"dateCreated":"2006-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nicely done","reviewBody":"I've never been much of a fan of Cornelia Funke's "Wilde Hühner" books, so I took my 7-year-old daughter to see this with some reluctance. I was agreeably surprised, though. The story works, the kids are great, and what I liked best was the realistic portrayal of their family backgrounds, not quite the common fare in kid's movies. Most of it was subtly done, like in some of Astrid Lindgren's stories. These kids' troubles are for real, and if there's evil in this film, it's the evil of thoughtless neglect on the part of the parents. Every kid (and adult) can identify with that. The dialog tended to be too heavy sometimes, but this is the only real fault I could find. Gripping and touching.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":715,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"genre":["Adventure","Family"],"datePublished":"2006-02-09","keywords":"friendship,teacher,friend,strong female,chicken","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1922105/","name":"Michelle von Treuberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2080273/","name":"Lucie Hollmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1743114/","name":"Paula Romy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0618996/","name":"Vivian Naefe"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026739/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050457/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1751315/","name":"Cornelia Funke"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0438651/","name":"Güzin Kar"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0716966/","name":"Uschi Reich"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Die Drei !!
Die Drei !!!
programme.desc:
Die Drei !!!: Directed by Viviane Andereggen. With Lilli Marie Lacher, Alexandra Petzschmann, Paula Renzler, Jürgen Vogel. Friends Franzi, Marieave and Kim planned to spend the summer rehearsing for a Peter Pan play, but when strange things start to happen at the theatre they take on the role of investigators." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8851630/","name":"Die Drei !!!","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGE2ZjRlMTEtNTNhMy00YThlLTlmNmEtZjk4YThiOWI4YmI2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTI5NzYzNzI0._V1_.jpg","description":"Friends Franzi, Marieave and Kim planned to spend the summer rehearsing for a Peter Pan play, but when strange things start to happen at the theatre they take on the role of investigators.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8851630/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"thefbiboy"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"The best children-centered live action movie 2019 out of a established franchise","reviewBody":"I have to disagree with the one other review here on imdb: DIe Drei !!! is indeed a long thriving audio book series. While I'm not listing to the all female cast audio book, I watched this together with Benjamin Blümchen 2019 and TKKG 2019. I always was more of a TKKG Guy but personally I have to say that this production is *way better* than TKKG 2019.

The characters seem true to themselve (while I can't verify that since I do not listen to the original), I did get fouled by the dozend red herrings along the case and there were no real goofs involved (like in TKKG 2019 with basicley every actor being a goof once older than 19 except for Tim's mom)

 If you're fan of Die Drei !!! and like children-based crime stories, die Drei !!! is a must see.

Parents beware: There is one time a character said a foul world, but besides that, there is really nothing to be afraid of.

(I'm a soical worker in kindergarden)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":171,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"genre":["Adventure","Family"],"datePublished":"2019-07-25","keywords":"theater,overalls","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2480585753","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMxZDU4YTgtYmJkOS00MjcxLWI4YjQtZGVkMTQxNGYyNDM2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMxZDU4YTgtYmJkOS00MjcxLWI4YjQtZGVkMTQxNGYyNDM2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7660569/","name":"Lilli Marie Lacher"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10256366/","name":"Alexandra Petzschmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8419274/","name":"Paula Renzler"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5899290/","name":"Viviane Andereggen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065798/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035336/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6592898/","name":"Sina Flammang"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8855280/","name":"Doris Laske"}],"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Scoob
Scooby! Voll verwedelt
programme.desc:
Scoob!: Directed by Tony Cervone. With Will Forte, Mark Wahlberg, Jason Isaacs, Gina Rodriguez. Scooby and the gang face their most challenging mystery ever: a plot to unleash the ghost dog Cerberus upon the world. As they race to stop this dogpocalypse, the gang discovers that Scooby has an epic destiny greater than anyone imagined." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3152592/","name":"Scoob!","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTJmODM0MDQtMTRjYy00YWZjLThjODItMzQ5N2I2NDBjYzA1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDA4NzMyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Scooby and the gang face their most challenging mystery ever: a plot to unleash the ghost dog Cerberus upon the world. It starts and it's super cute and actually resembles Scooby-Doo. But then it just goes off the rails. It has stupid cameos, pop culture nonsense like dabbing?? It was so basic. The plot was just nonsense and boring.

I don't love the animation style they look like they are made from each plastic and the voice acting is kinda off putting because for the most part non of the characters sound like any incarnation of them from the past which is strange as some of the old cast members spoke about wanting to return and were disappointed not to be asked.

My other complaint is there want really a main monster to fight against it seemed to randomly pop up in the end. programme.title: Shrek
Shrek – Der tollkühne Held
programme.desc: Shrek: Directed by Andrew Adamson, Vicky Jenson. With Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy, Cameron Diaz, John Lithgow. A mean lord exiles fairytale creatures to the swamp of a grumpy ogre, who must go on a quest and rescue a princess for the lord in order to get his land back." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0126029/","name":"Shrek","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGZhM2FhNTItODAzNi00YjA0LWEyN2UtNjJlYWQzYzU1MDg5L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mean lord exiles fairytale creatures to the swamp of a grumpy ogre, who must go on a quest and rescue a princess for the lord in order to get his land back.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0126029/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Reneewill5"},"dateCreated":"2001-09-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Shrek is a delight for all ages!","reviewBody":"Shrek is a movie like no other. It stands alone in its appeal to people of all ages and in its presentation of comedy, romance, and creative story line. Shrek is a delightful comedy about a crude ogre, an energetic princess, a witty donkey and an uptight ruler. The movie has a brilliant story line, following the path of an initially moody ogre as he discovers friendship and love all in the face of hysterical comedy. The story line is layered for different levels of understanding; it is an enjoyable film for people of all ages. One clever tool Shrek uses to humor the audience is its spoof on other fairy tales. In one scene, Princess Fiona's singing causes a bluebird to explode. And in another scene, the Magic Mirror's description of Snow White is "She may live with seven men, but don't be fooled, she's not easy." While these subtle comedic lines amuse adults, it is the simple humor, such as the movie opening with the ogre sitting in a swamp "farting," that amuses children. The amazing cast of Shrek, including Eddie Murphy and Mike Myers does a great job of living up to their comedic expectations. Shrek has something for everyone; it is a great animated tale that is wonderful for adults and children alike."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":642619,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2001-08-15","keywords":"onion,epic,cult film,exploding animal,arm ripped off","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Shrek","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4085711129","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmU5ZDE5NTItN2I1YS00ZmFmLTk3YTgtNzQwOGNkYzFjOWRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmU5ZDE5NTItN2I1YS00ZmFmLTk3YTgtNzQwOGNkYzFjOWRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Dreamworks"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000196/","name":"Mike Myers"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000552/","name":"Eddie Murphy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000139/","name":"Cameron Diaz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0011470/","name":"Andrew Adamson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0421776/","name":"Vicky Jenson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129164/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0069464/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0825308/","name":"William Steig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0254645/","name":"Ted Elliott"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0744429/","name":"Terry Rossio"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

A mean lord exiles fairytale creatures to the swamp of a grumpy ogre, who must go on a quest and rescue a princess for the lord in order to get his land back." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0126029/","name":"Shrek","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGZhM2FhNTItODAzNi00YjA0LWEyN2UtNjJlYWQzYzU1MDg5L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mean lord exiles fairytale creatures to the swamp of a grumpy ogre, who must go on a quest and rescue a princess for the lord in order to get his land back.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0126029/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Reneewill5","dateCreated":"2001-09-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Shrek is a delight for all ages!","reviewBody":"Shrek is a movie like no other. It stands alone in its appeal to people of all ages and in its presentation of comedy, romance, and creative story line. Shrek is a delightful comedy about a crude ogre, an energetic princess, a witty donkey and an uptight ruler. The movie has a brilliant story line, following the path of an initially moody ogre as he discovers friendship and love all in the face of hysterical comedy. The story line is layered for different levels of understanding; it is an enjoyable film for people of all ages. One clever tool Shrek uses to humor the audience is its spoof on other fairy tales. In one scene, Princess Fiona's singing causes a bluebird to explode. And in another scene, the Magic Mirror's description of Snow White is "She may live with seven men, but don't be fooled, she's not easy." While these subtle comedic lines amuse adults, it is the simple humor, such as the movie opening with the ogre sitting in a swamp "farting," that amuses children. The amazing cast of Shrek, including Eddie Murphy and Mike Myers does a great job of living up to their comedic expectations. Shrek has something for everyone; it is a great animated tale that is wonderful for adults and children alike.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":642619,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2001-08-15","keywords":"onion,epic,cult film,exploding animal,arm ripped off","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Shrek","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4085711129","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmU5ZDE5NTItN2I1YS00ZmFmLTk3YTgtNzQwOGNkYzFjOWRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmU5ZDE5NTItN2I1YS00ZmFmLTk3YTgtNzQwOGNkYzFjOWRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Dreamworks","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000196/","name":"Mike Myers","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000552/","name":"Eddie Murphy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000139/","name":"Cameron Diaz"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0011470/","name":"Andrew Adamson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0421776/","name":"Vicky Jenson"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129164/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0069464/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0825308/","name":"William Steig","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0254645/","name":"Ted Elliott","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0744429/","name":"Terry Rossio"],"duration":"PT1H30M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: New Year's Eve
Happy New Year
programme.desc:
New Year's Eve: Directed by Garry Marshall. With Michelle Pfeiffer, Zac Efron, Charlotte Marshall-Fricker, Fiona Choi. The lives of several couples and singles in New York City intertwine over the course of New Year's Eve." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1598822/","name":"New Year's Eve","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI2Mzg2MDQxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzc3NTY5Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of several couples and singles in New York City intertwine over the course of New Year's Eve.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1598822/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JimmyCollins"},"dateCreated":"2011-12-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Too many story lines make New Years Eve a bit of a dud.","reviewBody":"I rather enjoy the odd ensemble comedy such as this film, I somewhat enjoyed Valentines Day and I really enjoyed He's Just Not That Into You, but what those film had but this doesn't is a fewer amount of plot lines. There's just too much going on in this film, far too many characters, as soon as I found myself interested in one plot its segment would end, you can never get really attached to one set of characters.

For me the best storyline was the Michelle Pfieffer and Zefron plot, it was really the only one with a bit of substance, I actually think a full movie of that story would be great, also the Jessica Biel and Seth Meyers plot was rather funny thanks to the highly underrated Ms Biel. This movie is entertaining enough I suppose but it's also lacking any real great laugh out loud moments, the only time I laughed was when Jessica Biel was in labour, she could do some great comedy if given the chance.

Lea Michele manages to bring her great screen charisma to the big screen, she is very fun to watch and her rendition of Aude Lang Syne was lovely and a nice way to end the movie.

If this movie had about four or five less stories happening this movie would have been much better, it's not horrible by any standards but it's not excellent either, also this may sound mean but Sofia Vergara is possibly the most annoying actress alive, at least they didn't put a decent actress in the most annoying role in the film. I mean it's worth paying to see the excellent dance scene between Zefron and Pfieffer over the end credits.

OK, but basically it's exactly the same as Valentines Day but with more actors and a lot less substance.

Enjoy. Maybe.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":83887,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2011-12-09","keywords":"ensemble film,new year,new year's eve,singer,expecting","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi673095449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NDM0MTc3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU1MzU4Ng@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NDM0MTc3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU1MzU4Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The lives of several couples and singles in New York intertwine over the course of New Year's Eve. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000572/","name":"Sarah Jessica Parker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004754/","name":"Jessica Biel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005110/","name":"Ashton Kutcher"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005190/","name":"Garry Marshall"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0176486/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033868/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0297545/","name":"Katherine Fugate"}],"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: It's Complicated
Wenn Liebe so einfach wäre
programme.desc: It's Complicated: Directed by Nancy Meyers. With Meryl Streep, Steve Martin, Alec Baldwin, John Krasinski. When attending their son's college graduation, a couple reignite the spark in their relationship. But the complicated fact is they're divorced and he's remarried." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1230414/","name":"It's Complicated","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQ0NjM2NTI4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjQ2MDc5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When attending their son's college graduation, a couple reignite the spark in their relationship. But the complicated fact is they're divorced and he's remarried.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1230414/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"barrys82"},"dateCreated":"2010-02-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Watch it just for its cast","reviewBody":"The name of the movie is It's Complicated but the film is everything but complicated, in fact this is the simplest and lightest movie I've seen in a very long time. It's Complicated follows the story of Jane (Streep) that during her son's graduation hooks up with her ex-husband Jake (Baldwin)and at the same time she is dating Adam, her architect. The movie has some good moments of humor but the situations tends to repeat over and over making the movie a little boring. The story is kinda predictable and the plot is a bit lame and corny but the movie is worthy because of its cast. Actors like Alec Baldwin and Steve Maritn and an actress like Meryl Streep make it a real joy. Their performances are excellent and so funny. In conclusion, It's complicated is a movie mostly intended for people over 30's and 40's. Women will love it and men will enjoy it also","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":89907,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2010-02-03","keywords":"mature romance,female protagonist,lovers,ex husband ex wife rekindling their relationship,divorced couple","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"It's Complicated -- International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1404699929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxNTc0NjU3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzc0MTM5Mg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxNTc0NjU3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzc0MTM5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A romantic comedy in which a divorced man (Baldwin) vies for the affection of his ex-wife (Streep), who is being courted by an architect (Martin)."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000658/","name":"Meryl Streep"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000188/","name":"Steve Martin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000285/","name":"Alec Baldwin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0583600/","name":"Nancy Meyers"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114441/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0583600/","name":"Nancy Meyers"}],"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Valentine's Day
Valentinstag
programme.desc:
Valentine's Day: Directed by Garry Marshall. With Jessica Alba, Kathy Bates, Jessica Biel, Bradley Cooper. Intertwining couples and singles in Los Angeles break-up and make-up based on the pressures and expectations of Valentine's Day." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0817230/","name":"Valentine's Day","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk3MTIwNDIxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDMyMzcwMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Intertwining couples and singles in Los Angeles break-up and make-up based on the pressures and expectations of Valentine's Day.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0817230/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Mademoiselle_Lemon"},"dateCreated":"2010-11-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Dreadful","reviewBody":"You don't know what awful is until you've seen this film. I wasn't looking for a profound commentary on the human experience - I watched "Valentine's Day" expecting 100 minutes worth of harmless and fun escapism. To say that I was disappointed is a bit of an understatement.

To begin with, the film is WAY too long - or perhaps it just seems like an eternity. Minute after minute, it is sickeningly sappy and sweet, without any depth of character or plot to justify its duration. The acting is for the most part atrocious - or, at best, mediocre. Taylor Swift, in a nightmarish "comic relief" role, and the annoying little boy, in particular, stand out as paragons of annoying incompetence. However, the writing is so awful, even the greatest of thespians could not make this movie bearable. I honestly felt rather embarrassed for the actors, most of whom I'm sure are quite capable if given a half-decent script. Perhaps worst of all, "Valentine's Day" acts like it is an eye-opening and touching study of human relationships, while it's really drivel.

If there's anything I'd like the reader to learn from this review it's to avoid this film at all costs. It isn't good, it isn't even so-bad-it's-good - it's just plain dreadful."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":117245,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2010-02-10","keywords":"grandmother grandson relationship,grandfather grandson relationship,car,barefoot male,man wrapped in a towel","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Valentine's Day -- International Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2244215833","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4NTY5NzEyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4NTY5NzEyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Intertwining couples and singles in Los Angeles break-up and make-up based on the pressures and expectations of Valentine's Day."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000210/","name":"Julia Roberts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004937/","name":"Jamie Foxx"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004266/","name":"Anne Hathaway"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005190/","name":"Garry Marshall"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0176486/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033868/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0297545/","name":"Katherine Fugate"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0463359/","name":"Abby Kohn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0799050/","name":"Marc Silverstein"}],"duration":"PT2H5M"}</script><metacontent="

To say that I was disappointed is a bit of an understatement.

To begin with, the film is WAY too long - or perhaps it just seems like an eternity. Minute after minute, it is sickeningly sappy and sweet, without any depth of character or plot to justify its duration. The acting is for the most part atrocious - or, at best, mediocre. Taylor Swift, in a nightmarish "comic relief" role, and the annoying little boy, in particular, stand out as paragons of annoying incompetence. However, the writing is so awful, even the greatest of thespians could not make this movie bearable. I honestly felt rather embarrassed for the actors, most of whom I'm sure are quite capable if given a half-decent script. Perhaps worst of all, "Valentine's Day" acts like it is an eye-opening and touching study of human relationships, while it's really drivel.

If there's anything I'd like the reader to learn from this review it's to avoid this film at all costs. It isn't good, it isn't even so-bad-it's-good - it's just plain dreadful.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":117245,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2010-02-10","keywords":"grandmother grandson relationship,grandfather grandson relationship,car,barefoot male,man wrapped in a towel","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Valentine's Day -- International Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2244215833","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4NTY5NzEyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4NTY5NzEyMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Intertwining couples and singles in Los Angeles break-up and make-up based on the pressures and expectations of Valentine's Day.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000210/","name":"Julia Roberts","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004937/","name":"Jamie Foxx","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004266/","name":"Anne Hathaway"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005190/","name":"Garry Marshall"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0176486/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033868/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0297545/","name":"Katherine Fugate","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0463359/","name":"Abby Kohn","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0799050/","name":"Marc Silverstein"],"duration":"PT2H5M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Stuart Little
Stuart Little
programme.desc:
Stuart Little: Directed by Rob Minkoff. With Michael J. Fox, Geena Davis, Hugh Laurie, Jonathan Lipnicki. The Little family adopt a charming young mouse named Stuart, but the family cat wants rid of him." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0164912/","name":"Stuart Little","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDJlZWZiODItMGE3NC00Yzg3LWFhYTYtZTI2YWNlNjExMDE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Little family adopt a charming young mouse named Stuart, but the family cat wants rid of him.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0164912/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TheUnknown837-1"},"dateCreated":"2008-06-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"great family film with a good heart","reviewBody":"Both "Stuart Little" and its first sequel, titled "Stuart Little 2" are two nice little family films that I recommend for their effective blend of drama, adult humor that never goes out of hand, controlled suspense and violence as well as language, and yet it never gets so immature as to become only for the kids. Some critics thought that the movie might have had some moments too intense or unsuited for young children. I was eight years old when I first saw this film and it never bothered me. I was surprised to find swearing in this film, but again, it didn't degrade the film because it was sparingly used and by that I mean it was only used once or twice.

The character of Stuart is very effectively brought onto the screen. The mouse is entirely computer-generated in an efficient way and the contributions of Michael J. Fox's voice work out very well. The same goes for the other animated characters. All of the live-action performances were well-done and they blended in perfectly with the CGI characters.

"Stuart Little" has a good heart and it is can be a very warm little family movie for everybody to enjoy. I still enjoy it nine years after I first saw the film and I do recommend it. It's a film that will suit audience members of all ages. As long as you enjoy family films.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":130441,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2000-03-15","keywords":"alley cat,cat actor,boat,boy,scene during end credits","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Stuart Little","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4253417753","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmU1ODBiZGQtNzRkNy00ODRhLWI2ZjktMjZiZWI0YjYzOWRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmU1ODBiZGQtNzRkNy00ODRhLWI2ZjktMjZiZWI0YjYzOWRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000150/","name":"Michael J. programme.title: Stuart Little 2
Stuart Little 2
programme.desc:
Stuart Little 2: Directed by Rob Minkoff. With Michael J. Fox, Geena Davis, Hugh Laurie, Jonathan Lipnicki. Stuart and Snowbell set out across town to rescue a friend." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0243585/","name":"Stuart Little 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYyNDg0Njc2Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMDc3NzQ3._V1_.jpg","description":"Stuart and Snowbell set out across town to rescue a friend.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0243585/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"StevePulaski"},"dateCreated":"2012-10-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"A parable on drifting siblings","reviewBody":"Stuart Little 2 is one of those children's films that appeals to both the children and those who must pay the ticket price. I thought those kinds of films only existed with the name "Pixar" stamped on them or the occasional "Dreamworks." The film largely compiles odds and ends from the first film to try and lift the sequel off its feet but its sweet, good-natured charisma and kinetic warmth make the seventy-eight minute endeavor worth it.

The "Little" family are still happy, vibrant, and warm in their quest to give their new mouse sibling, Stuart (voiced by Michael J. Fox) a home he can be proud of. Yet the mother (Geena Davis) still worries that Stuart's small stature gives him the unfair advantage in sports and life itself, while the father (Hugh Laurie) is more of an optimist and feels that if a Little applies himself, he can be quite the character.

The main themes Stuart Little 2 tries to explore, however, are not about doing anything you want to do and proving that being small isn't a limitation but a welcomed challenge, like the first film, but more about siblings that drift away from each other. Stuart's older brother, George (Jonathan Lipnicki) is beginning to spend more time with his friends rather than Stuart, and while this is a natural part of life, it is nonetheless heartbreaking to the mouse himself, who begins to view himself as just a pest (no pun intended).

Stuart begins to befriend a small yellow canary named Margalo (Melanie Griffith), who he rescued after seeing her being pursued by an ominous falcon in the sky. It turns out, Margalo is in cahoots with the falcon to steal valuables from homes all across New York City, but little Margalo keeps that secret away from Stuart when she discovers how kind and gentle he really is.

Stuart Little 2 isn't particularly compelling or a very life-affirming film, but it's a genial, warm picture, with great computer effects, wonderful yet subtle themes on sibling relationships, and a plethora of jokes that kids and adults will find pleasing and joyful.

Starring: Geena Davis, Hugh Laurie, and Jonathan Lipnicki. Voiced by: Michael J. Fox, Melanie Griffith, and Nathan Lane. Directed by: Rob Minkoff.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":52642,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2002-09-04","keywords":"live action cgi hybrid,animal character name as title,stuart little character,man wears eyeglasses,boy wears eyeglasses","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Stuart Little 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4035313945","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWFiZTk0NzQtNWE4Ny00Mzk4LWFhZDYtMzBlMTk2YWI2MDIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWFiZTk0NzQtNWE4Ny00Mzk4LWFhZDYtMzBlMTk2YWI2MDIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000150/","name":"Michael J. programme.desc: Yogi Bear: Directed by Eric Brevig. With Dan Aykroyd, Justin Timberlake, Anna Faris, Tom Cavanagh. A documentary filmmaker travels to Jellystone Park to shoot a project and soon crosses paths with Yogi Bear, his sidekick Boo-Boo and Ranger Smith." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1302067/","name":"Yogi Bear","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmI0ZmMwMDYtNTk4OC00NGNhLTk3NDUtNjFmZTI5NTUzYTFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTUyMzE4Mzg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A documentary filmmaker travels to Jellystone Park to shoot a project and soon crosses paths with Yogi Bear, his sidekick Boo-Boo and Ranger Smith.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1302067/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JustAnEpicPerson"},"dateCreated":"2013-06-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"A good 3D movie for the kids.","reviewBody":"Yogi Bear is about Jellystone Park about to get closed down because the town is bankrupt. Due to this, Ranger Smith (Tom Cavanagh) throws a party for Jellystone so more visitors come in, more visitors, more money. But Yogi screws it up. So now they must save the park somehow before it gets closed. Yogi (Dan Aykroyd) and Boo Boo (Justin Timberlake) do a good job at voice acting. Tom Cavanagh also does a good job, but everyone else does a bad job. ESPIALLY THE MAYOR (Andrew Daly) HE DOES NOT EVEN TRY. The 3D is pretty good, so if you have a Blu-ray 3D at home, try to rent this movie.\n\nOVERALL: It's funny, great 3D, and pretty good. Go see it, you won't be disappointed."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":21370,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.6},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2011-01-12","keywords":"park,bear,mayor,sabotage,documentary filmmaker","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Yogi Bear: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2698381593","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk5Nzg3NDYzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDEyODIzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk5Nzg3NDYzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDEyODIzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A documentary filmmaker travels to Jellystone Park to shoot a project and soon crosses paths with Yogi Bear, his sidekick Boo-Boo, and Ranger Smith."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000101/","name":"Dan Aykroyd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005493/","name":"Justin Timberlake"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0267506/","name":"Anna Faris"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0108094/","name":"Eric Brevig"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0226011/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033149/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0893262/","name":"Jennifer Ventimilia"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0827985/","name":"Joshua Sternin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0178589/","name":"Brad Copeland"}],"duration":"PT1H21M"}</script><metacontent="

Ballerina: Directed by Eric Summer, Éric Warin, Mimi Maynard, Paulette Victor-Lifton. With Elle Fanning, Dane DeHaan, Carly Rae Jepsen, Maddie Ziegler. An orphan girl dreams of becoming a ballerina and flees her rural Brittany for Paris, where she passes for someone else and accedes to the position of pupil at the Grand Opera house." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2261287/","name":"Ballerina","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjEzMmFlNWUtYTFhOC00ZDMxLTllZmItZjc3ODMwNTk2ZmNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTY2ODgzODg@._V1_.jpg","description":"An orphan girl dreams of becoming a ballerina and flees her rural Brittany for Paris, where she passes for someone else and accedes to the position of pupil at the Grand Opera house.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2261287/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Barracuda007"},"dateCreated":"2017-05-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Charming movie about chasing your dreams and never giving up","reviewBody":"Im a huge fan for animation, I heard about this movie and didn't really know what to expect. What I got was a beautiful movie with the positive messages of chasing your dreams and never giving up on them no matter how hard things may seem.

I do kinda wish the subplot of victor could have tied in more with the main focus of Felicie but it is what it is, I ain't complaining.

Finally, It was hilarious and very charming too. Perfect for families. programme.title: Vorstadtkrokodile
Vorstadtkrokodile
programme.desc: Vorstadtkrokodile: Directed by Christian Ditter. With Nick Romeo Reimann, Fabian Halbig, Leonie Tepe, Manuel Steitz. Hannes wants to be a member of the crocodiles. To be a part of them he has to do something dangerous. When he is finally a member of them they experience dangerous adventures together." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0803100/","name":"Vorstadtkrokodile","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0NjA2NTU0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDY1NDY1Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Hannes wants to be a member of the crocodiles. To be a part of them he has to do something dangerous. When he is finally a member of them they experience dangerous adventures together.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0803100/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jannispetersen"},"dateCreated":"2009-03-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Beautiful and moving modern version!","reviewBody":"I didn't know what to expect of the filmatisation of the well-known German novel Vorstadtkrokodile. What I actually can remember is that when I read this novel as a child, I back then thought of, it would be great as a movie. So when I saw this movie is in the cinemas, I had to watch it. And I'm very glad to have done so! First of all the cast is great! Axel Stein does a really great job and also Semmelrogge is very funny in his short scene. I didn't know any of the youngsters, but all of them played their part very well - you instantly buy their roles the way they play them! And then there is the modernization of the context. Enormeausly well-done! Many nice gags, where I laughed out loud! This is a movie for everyone: the youngsters, young adults (like me, I'm in the middle of my twenties) and the elder generation! I hope you have read the novel, but if you haven't, I'm sure you are eager to do, after you watched this fantastic movie.\n\nHeck! I even caught myself gladly smiling at the very end!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1248,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"genre":["Adventure","Family"],"datePublished":"2009-03-26","keywords":"first part,animal in title,based on novel","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2180198/","name":"Nick Romeo Reimann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2526264/","name":"Fabian Halbig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3036132/","name":"Leonie Tepe"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228542/","name":"Christian Ditter"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065798/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035336/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228542/","name":"Christian Ditter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0728894/","name":"Martin Ritzenhoff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0902149/","name":"Max von der Grün"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

With Nick Romeo Reimann, Fabian Halbig, Leonie Tepe, Manuel Steitz." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1473352/","name":"Vorstadtkrokodile 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDAyNTY2NDUxMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTMxMDkxMjE@._V1_.jpg","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1473352/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Mozjoukine"},"dateCreated":"2010-04-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Accomplished German kid-flick.","reviewBody":"It' agreeable to find this accomplished sequel to the German kid flick has production values that would sustain adult entertainment - good pacing, convincing staging and engaging cast.

Much juggling to give all the members of the gang attention, with blond kung-fu baby sitter Gollmer coming off best. Attempt at significance, with a computer criminal closing down the factory that the area depends on, till thwarted by the crocodile gang fresh from a previous anti crime operation.

High contrast colour camera-work and extensive use of studio and location give a professional finish."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":708,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"genre":["Adventure","Family"],"datePublished":"2010-01-21","keywords":"second part,numbered sequel,sequel,animal in title,based on novel","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2180198/","name":"Nick Romeo Reimann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2526264/","name":"Fabian Halbig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3036132/","name":"Leonie Tepe"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228542/","name":"Christian Ditter"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065798/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035336/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0257869/","name":"Neil Ennever"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228542/","name":"Christian Ditter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0902149/","name":"Max von der Grün"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Vorstadtkrokodile 3: Directed by Wolfgang Groos. With Nick Romeo Reimann, Fabian Halbig, Leonie Tepe, Manuel Steitz. The Crocodiles regroup and plan a prison break. It's an emergency and Frank needs his brother's help, but Denis sits in jail." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1692503/","name":"Vorstadtkrokodile 3","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2NTAyNjY4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTMwMjA1NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Crocodiles regroup and plan a prison break. It's an emergency and Frank needs his brother's help, but Denis sits in jail.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1692503/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2021-07-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"One last time","reviewBody":"The kids are all grown up ... well they were not when this movie was made. Not entirely at least. Still a little bit older than when they started making them. So part 3 concludes their journey. And is as dramatic as they get. The inciting incident does not seem that big ... but turns out it is .. life an death and all that.\n\nHaving said that, the movie is still overall not riddled with heavy drama, even with that hanging over their heads, there is time for jealousy and other issues one might have growing up. We get our villains back from the first one, but this time around ... well we sort of hope they have grown up too ... not just physically but metaphorically speaking ... I reckon there is not too much mystery or things you'll be surprised will happen in the journey of the movie. Still a neat little movie that is mainly aimed at younger people.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":634,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2011-01-20","keywords":"boy in a wheelchair,overalls,stutterer,outtakes during end credits,working mom","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2180198/","name":"Nick Romeo Reimann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2526264/","name":"Fabian Halbig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3036132/","name":"Leonie Tepe"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0343185/","name":"Wolfgang Groos"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065798/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035336/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228542/","name":"Christian Ditter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0046910/","name":"Thomas Bahmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0381074/","name":"Ralf Hertwig"}],"duration":"PT1H21M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Shrek
Shrek – Der tollkühne Held
programme.desc: Shrek: Directed by Andrew Adamson, Vicky Jenson. With Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy, Cameron Diaz, John Lithgow. A mean lord exiles fairytale creatures to the swamp of a grumpy ogre, who must go on a quest and rescue a princess for the lord in order to get his land back." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0126029/","name":"Shrek","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGZhM2FhNTItODAzNi00YjA0LWEyN2UtNjJlYWQzYzU1MDg5L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mean lord exiles fairytale creatures to the swamp of a grumpy ogre, who must go on a quest and rescue a princess for the lord in order to get his land back.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0126029/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Reneewill5"},"dateCreated":"2001-09-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Shrek is a delight for all ages!","reviewBody":"Shrek is a movie like no other. It stands alone in its appeal to people of all ages and in its presentation of comedy, romance, and creative story line. Shrek is a delightful comedy about a crude ogre, an energetic princess, a witty donkey and an uptight ruler. The movie has a brilliant story line, following the path of an initially moody ogre as he discovers friendship and love all in the face of hysterical comedy. The story line is layered for different levels of understanding; it is an enjoyable film for people of all ages. One clever tool Shrek uses to humor the audience is its spoof on other fairy tales. In one scene, Princess Fiona's singing causes a bluebird to explode. And in another scene, the Magic Mirror's description of Snow White is "She may live with seven men, but don't be fooled, she's not easy." While these subtle comedic lines amuse adults, it is the simple humor, such as the movie opening with the ogre sitting in a swamp "farting," that amuses children. The amazing cast of Shrek, including Eddie Murphy and Mike Myers does a great job of living up to their comedic expectations. Shrek has something for everyone; it is a great animated tale that is wonderful for adults and children alike."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":642619,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2001-08-15","keywords":"onion,epic,cult film,exploding animal,arm ripped off","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Shrek","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4085711129","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmU5ZDE5NTItN2I1YS00ZmFmLTk3YTgtNzQwOGNkYzFjOWRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmU5ZDE5NTItN2I1YS00ZmFmLTk3YTgtNzQwOGNkYzFjOWRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Dreamworks"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000196/","name":"Mike Myers"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000552/","name":"Eddie Murphy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000139/","name":"Cameron Diaz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0011470/","name":"Andrew Adamson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0421776/","name":"Vicky Jenson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129164/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0069464/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0825308/","name":"William Steig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0254645/","name":"Ted Elliott"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0744429/","name":"Terry Rossio"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Shrek 2
Shrek 2 – Der tollkühne Held kehrt zurück
programme.desc:
Shrek 2: Directed by Andrew Adamson, Kelly Asbury, Conrad Vernon. With Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy, Cameron Diaz, Julie Andrews. Shrek and Fiona travel to the Kingdom of Far Far Away, where Fiona's parents are King and Queen, to celebrate their marriage. When they arrive, they find they are not as welcome as they thought they would be." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0298148/","name":"Shrek 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDJhMGRjN2QtNDUxYy00NGM3LThjNGQtMmZiZTRhNjM4YzUxL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Shrek and Fiona travel to the Kingdom of Far Far Away, where Fiona's parents are King and Queen, to celebrate their marriage. When they arrive, they find they are not as welcome as they thought they would be.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0298148/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mstomaso"},"dateCreated":"2005-04-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Respectable effort with a tough act to follow","reviewBody":"Shrek 2 has as much humor, talent, and fun as the original classic, and almost as much heart. The film picks up where Shrek left off, with Fiona and Shrek celebrating their marriage, but they are immediately cast into a new adventure when summoned to the land of Far Far Away (a clever parody of Hollywood), to the court of Fiona's mother and father, for a surprise royal wedding ball. The only problem, as it turns out, is that Fiona has married the wrong guy - according to everybody but Shrek, Fiona, and their friends.

The plot, revolving around this central problem, is helped along by nearly constant allusions to virtually every fairy tale in the English canon, and satirical references to many recent popular films. Unsatisfied with the combination of romantic comedy, Hollywood satire and self-parody, the film-makers' also went all out with a clever original soundtrack, making Shrek 2 as much of a musical as anything else.

The voice talent is just as essential as it was in the first film, and there's more of it, with John Cleese and Antonio Banderas giving very memorable performances. And the animation is, unsurprisingly, lovely.

To their credit, Dreamworks kept the core talent in place, but created a somewhat different formula for this film. Even though I expect most fans of the first film to adore the second, I am not sure Shrek 2 is going to make the franchise any new fans. Though more clearly made for adult audiences than the original, Shrek 2 is still warm-hearted family fare. As much as I DO recommend this film, and as entertaining as I think it will be for just about anybody, I don't consider Shrek 2 to be quite the classic Shrek was. It's touching and goofy, to be sure, but it's much more of a Hollywood film than the original, and it doesn't quite reach the same levels. Nevertheless, it is one of the better sequels I have seen, and it was definitely worth both the price of admission and a third or fourth viewing of the DVD.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":439461,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2004-08-04","keywords":"reference to spider man,ogre,cat,princess,puss in boots","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Shrek 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1447231513","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGRhNGQwNjUtYmFlMS00ODdiLWI3YTUtNjViOWYzZmU2YzhjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGRhNGQwNjUtYmFlMS00ODdiLWI3YTUtNjViOWYzZmU2YzhjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Dreamworks"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000196/","name":"Mike Myers"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000552/","name":"Eddie Murphy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000139/","name":"Cameron Diaz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0011470/","name":"Andrew Adamson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0038432/","name":"Kelly Asbury"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0970447/","name":"Conrad Vernon"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0069464/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129164/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0825308/","name":"William Steig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0011470/","name":"Andrew Adamson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0830294/","name":"Joe Stillman"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

When they arrive, they find they are not as welcome as they thought they would be.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0298148/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mstomaso","dateCreated":"2005-04-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Respectable effort with a tough act to follow","reviewBody":"Shrek 2 has as much humor, talent, and fun as the original classic, and almost as much heart. The film picks up where Shrek left off, with Fiona and Shrek celebrating their marriage, but they are immediately cast into a new adventure when summoned to the land of Far Far Away (a clever parody of Hollywood), to the court of Fiona's mother and father, for a surprise royal wedding ball. The only problem, as it turns out, is that Fiona has married the wrong guy - according to everybody but Shrek, Fiona, and their friends.

The plot, revolving around this central problem, is helped along by nearly constant allusions to virtually every fairy tale in the English canon, and satirical references to many recent popular films. The voice talent is just as essential as it was in the first film, and there's more of it, with John Cleese and Antonio Banderas giving very memorable performances. And the animation is, unsurprisingly, lovely.

As much as I DO recommend this film, and as entertaining as I think it will be for just about anybody, I don't consider Shrek 2 to be quite the classic Shrek was. It's touching and goofy, to be sure, but it's much more of a Hollywood film than the original, and it doesn't quite reach the same levels. Nevertheless, it is one of the better sequels I have seen, and it was definitely worth both the price of admission and a third or fourth viewing of the DVD.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":439461,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2004-08-04","keywords":"reference to spider man,ogre,cat,princess,puss in boots","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Shrek 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1447231513","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGRhNGQwNjUtYmFlMS00ODdiLWI3YTUtNjViOWYzZmU2YzhjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGRhNGQwNjUtYmFlMS00ODdiLWI3YTUtNjViOWYzZmU2YzhjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Dreamworks","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000196/","name":"Mike Myers","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000552/","name":"Eddie Murphy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000139/","name":"Cameron Diaz"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0011470/","name":"Andrew Adamson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0038432/","name":"Kelly Asbury","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0970447/","name":"Conrad Vernon"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0819670/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0069464/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129164/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0825308/","name":"William Steig","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0011470/","name":"Andrew Adamson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0830294/","name":"Joe Stillman"],"duration":"PT1H33M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Family Man
Family Man – Eine himmlische Entscheidung
programme.desc: The Family Man: Directed by Brett Ratner. With Nicolas Cage, Téa Leoni, Don Cheadle, Jeremy Piven. A fast-lane investment broker, offered the opportunity to see how the other half lives, wakes up to find that his sports car and girlfriend have become a mini-van and wife." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0218967/","name":"The Family Man","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzYzMTQ4NDYtNWRkZi00NTYxLThlZDItMzI1MmU1MmU5ZWQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDA5Mjg5MjA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A fast-lane investment broker, offered the opportunity to see how the other half lives, wakes up to find that his sports car and girlfriend have become a mini-van and wife.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0218967/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"whynotbacritic"},"dateCreated":"2004-11-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's A Wonderful Life in 2000","reviewBody":"I found this movie to be a very nice remix of "It's a Wonderful Life", much like "You've got Mail" is a remix of "Pride and Prejudice" (and totally hints at this within the film). A classic film to make you reexamine your own life, and think about what is really important and meaningful for you, what is success and happiness? Young dreamers in love with their successful careers instead of each other, find out that maybe their love really was meant to be. This is what Nicholas Cage finds out, and when he wakes up from the dream of what 'could have been', he rushes to stop 'loosing her' again, and hopefully still live the happily ever after dream. Nicholas Cage provides a stunning and comical performance in character, from the aggressive businessman - big business and small business - to a loving father and husband with his charming sense of humor. Quite a romantic film to watch with that 'someone special' during the holidays."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":107083,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2001-09-12","keywords":"christmas,parallel universe,career man,reflection,crisis of conscience","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi318685465","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWRmZjg2MTgtN2NmMS00ODAyLTg4OWItODFlMTRiZTBmNDY0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWRmZjg2MTgtN2NmMS00ODAyLTg4OWItODFlMTRiZTBmNDY0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000495/","name":"Téa Leoni"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000332/","name":"Don Cheadle"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0711840/","name":"Brett Ratner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0064908/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009876/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0224606/","name":"David Diamond"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0919289/","name":"David Weissman"}],"duration":"PT2H5M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Lassie - Eine abenteuerliche Reise: Directed by Hanno Olderdissen. With Nico Marischka, Sebastian Bezzel, Anna Maria Mühe, Bella Bading. Remake of the 1943 movie based on Eric Knight's book "Lassie Come Home"." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10384944/","name":"Lassie - Eine abenteuerliche Reise","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWE3YzAzY2EtNTJlOS00OTY2LWJhYzMtMzRlZjhjMzlhYTk0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODc0OTEyNDU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Remake of the 1943 movie based on Eric Knight's book "Lassie Come Home".","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10384944/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kovacsh-zoltan"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"A modernized mixed bag, go for the 2005, or 1943 version instead","reviewBody":"Based on the classic book but in modern setting and in Germany. It is droll and less serious than the previous 2 book adaptation films (less effort by all means), some characters are overplayed or annoying, altough may be funny for the youth. The movie has sad and weepy parts as expected, but some are kind of ruined by either a milldly forced joke or odd interaction. But not all the time odd, certain side stories and characters and their relationship are well implemented. Camerawork had quite some stuttering and optic faults (lens flare, too much saturation). Music was okay, but not memorable.\n\nYou can sit down with the family for this film, but won't be a lasting experience at all. This film is "meh to okay". But the 2005 british adaptation is lasting and not to mention the classic 1943 first movie. Watch those instead.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":423,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"genre":["Adventure","Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"2020-02-20","keywords":"boy dog relationship,border collie,north sea,lassie character,journey","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1825423129","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNjOWQyN2ItNDFhZC00YTQ4LWJmZTItMTExMDVmZTkzZmE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNjOWQyN2ItNDFhZC00YTQ4LWJmZTItMTExMDVmZTkzZmE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8354935/","name":"Nico Marischka"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0080134/","name":"Sebastian Bezzel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1031534/","name":"Anna Maria Mühe"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1315409/","name":"Hanno Olderdissen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0314266/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0502466/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0645969/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2203642/","name":"Jane Ainscough"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0460893/","name":"Eric Knight"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

But not all the time odd, certain side stories and characters and their relationship are well implemented. Camerawork had quite some stuttering and optic faults (lens flare, too much saturation). Music was okay, but not memorable.\n\nYou can sit down with the family for this film, but won't be a lasting experience at all. This film is "meh to okay". But the 2005 british adaptation is lasting and not to mention the classic 1943 first movie. Watch those instead.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":423,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7,"genre":["Adventure","Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"2020-02-20","keywords":"boy dog relationship,border collie,north sea,lassie character,journey","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1825423129","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNjOWQyN2ItNDFhZC00YTQ4LWJmZTItMTExMDVmZTkzZmE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNjOWQyN2ItNDFhZC00YTQ4LWJmZTItMTExMDVmZTkzZmE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8354935/","name":"Nico Marischka","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0080134/","name":"Sebastian Bezzel","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1031534/","name":"Anna Maria Mühe"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1315409/","name":"Hanno Olderdissen"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0314266/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0502466/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0645969/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2203642/","name":"Jane Ainscough","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0460893/","name":"Eric Knight"],"duration":"PT1H36M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Johnny English
Johnny English – Der Spion, der es versiebte
programme.desc: Johnny English: Directed by Peter Howitt. With Rowan Atkinson, Tasha de Vasconcelos, Ben Miller, Greg Wise. After a sudden attack on MI5, Johnny English, Britain's most confident, yet unintelligent spy, becomes Britain's only spy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0274166/","name":"Johnny English","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDkxODhlNmItYjhiMC00ZjNmLWE2YmMtOTQ3NmQxM2YzOGFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"After a sudden attack on MI5, Johnny English, Britain's most confident, yet unintelligent spy, becomes Britain's only spy.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0274166/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Dingataca"},"dateCreated":"2007-11-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Classic comedy!","reviewBody":"Silly as hell, but funny as anything! Rowan Atkinson once again shows the world his talents - impeccable comic timing, style, a little bit of cheekiness, and superb acting. This movie is a personal favourite of mine, and I reckon it is perfect to watch anytime you feel low or need some cheering up. The man who brought you Bean (1997), now brings you Johnny English, a parody of James Bond. I loved Bean, and I love this one just as much, if not more. Ignore the pathetic critics that rate this as crap, because it most certainly isn't. It is a piece of comedy that you will not regret seeing - I recommend this to anyone. Heck, even my grandmother liked it! (And that's saying something) \n\nSeriously, if you haven't watched this, you really need to."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":154699,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2003-05-28","keywords":"queen elizabeth ii character,slapstick comedy,looking at oneself in a mirror,character name as title,tied feet","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Johnny English","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1284702489","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjUwYmNkZmUtY2ZjMC00ZmM1LWEzMWMtNjE0NzY5NjI3OGI5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjUwYmNkZmUtY2ZjMC00ZmM1LWEzMWMtNjE0NzY5NjI3OGI5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000100/","name":"Rowan Atkinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000518/","name":"John Malkovich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001386/","name":"Natalie Imbruglia"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0398185/","name":"Peter Howitt"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0701031/","name":"Neal Purvis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0905498/","name":"Robert Wade"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0204030/","name":"William Davies"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

Piss off, Snow White." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5872472/","name":"Verpiss Dich, Schneewittchen","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmZmOTFlZmYtNzBiNC00N2FlLWIwM2YtMDcxNzVlYmUxYzc1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzA3Njg4MzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Piss off, Snow White.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5872472/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Snow White this isn't","reviewBody":"I did not know anything about this movie before I started watching it - apart from the title that is and the fact this is a comedy. I also think I recognize the main actor as a standup comedian. Though I don't really know many of them, so I may be wrong with that.\n\nJust letting you know, where I stand since some may be more familiar with him. I did recognize some of the other actors and some rappers too. The movie tries its best and I don't mean that in a bad way. Surely some will like its humor and its mellow tone and silly comedy. It is quite predictable, but the characters are likeable (mostly that is) and the actors are good too. This may just float your boat, if you're in the mood for it","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":274,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":2.8},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2018-03-29","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3985619737","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2N2NjYTEtNzY4NC00MzQ4LThlMmQtNGQxYzQwOTRiODhiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM2N2NjYTEtNzY4NC00MzQ4LThlMmQtNGQxYzQwOTRiODhiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1011962/","name":"Josefine Preuß"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2977411/","name":"Nilam Farooq"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1391248/","name":"Kida Khodr Ramadan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2677390/","name":"Cüneyt Kaya"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0070505/","name":"Rainer Bender"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2651653/","name":"Mathias Brod"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3429606/","name":"Stefan Höh"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

When Danny and Ludwig meet in a leisure park, they can hardly believe their eyes: not only do they look very similar, they are the same age. Their lives are otherwise very different, so the two boys decide to exchange places." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10567444/","name":"Takeover","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDQzMDc5MmQtYzI1Ni00ZTZkLTgxYjgtOGUyZDBhMTdlZGFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODc0OTEyNDU@._V1_.jpg","description":"When Danny and Ludwig meet in a leisure park, they can hardly believe their eyes: not only do they look very similar, they are the same age. programme.title: Ballermann 6
Ballermann 6
programme.desc: Ballermann 6: Directed by Gernot Roll, Tom Gerhardt. With Tom Gerhardt, Hilmi Sözer, Christoph M. Ohrt, Diana Frank. Scrambling up their last money, two dudes journey to Mallorca to fullfill their dream and participate in Europe's most famous beach parties." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0118678/","name":"Ballermann 6","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEzMTUyMDA0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzI4NjcxMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Scrambling up their last money, two dudes journey to Mallorca to fullfill their dream and participate in Europe's most famous beach parties.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0118678/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bscrooked"},"dateCreated":"2021-09-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"I love it","reviewBody":"I first saw this movie when I was like 15, 16 years old, partying on Mallorca/ at the Ballermann was an absolute highlight. I absolutely love the humor in this one, it's so stupid, I'm still dying over it every single time - and watched the movie uncountable times. Both main characters are absolutely hilarious. Over the top, but you can easily like them. I didn't like their two other movies "voll normaaal" and especially "die superbullen" very well, but they definitely nailed it with Ballermann 6. If you can get into the snese of humor, you've at least got to like it. I love it, top 10 of all time in personal ranking.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3138,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"1997-10-16","keywords":"german humor,german abroad,car,automobile,german car","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0314305/","name":"Tom Gerhardt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0845609/","name":"Hilmi Sözer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0290903/","name":"Diana Frank"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005846/","name":"Gernot Roll"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0314305/","name":"Tom Gerhardt"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011349/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037894/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0314305/","name":"Tom Gerhardt"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="
